description.narrative: Stödet till Transparency International Cambodia avser stöd för att etablera organisationen och för samarbete med andra relevanta aktörer inom regeringen, civila samhället, privata sektorn och forskarsamfundet

The support to TIC is a core support for establishing the institution and for cooperation with stakeholders in anti-corruption, including government, civil society, private sector and research community.

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: As the agreement between Sida and TIC was extended for 6 months, the last report of TIC and thereby also this results assessment covers merely 6 months i.e. January - July 2016. The purpose for this extention was to allow TIC to wrap-up outstanding activities of the first strategy phase (2012-2015) as well as to prepare for the coming strategy phase (2016-2020).
TIC has managed to implement activities as planned although the political climate in Cambodia has tightened somewhat during the reporting period and accusation of corrption at times as been used for political purposes. Some of the more significant results achieved during this period are as follows:
Debates on social media regarding judicial corruption and youth integrity in Cambodia were triggered by two short advocacy films earlier produced by TIC, which were re-disseminated during 2016.
The School of Governance was established during the first half of 2016 and the first batch of training is expected to take place in late 2016. This is a result of intensive collaboration between Ministry of Interior and TIC in developing a buisness plan, work plan, budget, M&E plan and the like.
The current political tension in Cambodia between the ruling party and the opposition has to a certain extent affected TIC's work with the Commission 10th of the National Assembly (which has an oversight role and handles corruption issues and cases) as planned training activities were not able to be conducted. TIC has managed to continue the collaboration by focusing on carrying out a capacity assessment and identify key training needs of the Commission 10th. Moreover, one knowledge-sharing session was held for all members of parliament on a policy paper regarding the benefits and best practices of a whistleblower protection law produced by TIC. The launch of this paper was also launched at the Ministry of Interior attended by a wide-range of Cambodian stakeholders and recieved an extensive media coverage.
TIC continued its work with making young people in Cambodia aware of the negative effects of corruption and ways of fighting it. Previous participants of the Young Leadership Programmes and youth camps have now formed new youth networks operating independently from TIC further strengthening and diversifying civil society in Cambodia.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
